site_name: Land To The Rear Of The Red Lion Public House
decision_conditions: The proposed security gates, refuse storage enclosure and revised access arrangement by reason of its design and layout would result in a poor pedestrian and vehicle arrangement that would result in an illogical use of the accessway to the detriment of the design and function of the site.  As such, the proposal would fail to comply with policies D1, D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021), policies 7B and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and section 12 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).
description: Minor material amendment (S.73) to vary condition no.2 (approved plans), seeking to relocate the cycle storage, remove the bin storage from the drawings and to remove the security gates at the end of the passageway from The Park,  in pursuant to planning permission reference 180366FUL dated 29/01/2019 for ''Construction of two pairs of semi-detached residential houses (a total of four) comprising ground and basement levels with private and communal amenity space at basement and ground level, landscaping, refuse and cycle storage''
